thread.title: Are These Arsenal's Kits For The 2017/18 Season?
thread.title_full: Are These Arsenal's Kits For The 2017/18 Season?

title: Are These Arsenal's Kits For The 2017/18 Season?
text:
Are These Arsenal's Kits For The 2017/18 Season? Thu Feb 23 2017 11:38:08   11:38:08 GMT+0000 (GMT) Josh Lawless Josh Lawless in football 
Some new images of what could well be Arsenal's kits for the 2017/18 season have emerged online. 
In some instances, 'leaked' kits don't turn out to be the actual kits for the next season but both Footy Headlines and ArsenalFanTV (taking a break from their famous fan-cams)appear to have got their hands on some images of what Arsenal's kits are likely to look like next season - irrespective of whether Arsene Wenger is in charge or not. 
Footy Headlines have published several images of Arsenal's 2017/18 home kit and in all fairness, it's not too different to the shirt Gunners players have been wearing for the current campaign. 
Puma are once again the kit makers, Fly Emirates remain sponsors and the design is predominantly red with a white trim - as has been the case for Arsenal for the past 10 years. 
The major difference is the collar on the shirt. 
Here are the images: 
ArsenalFanTV released images of the same shirt in what looks like a club shop setting, but it also contains two other kits. 
The first, presumably, the club's away kit, is a teal, turquoise colour with hints of royal blue. The final kit we see in the image, which looks like the goalkeepers kit - is a mixture of black and pink. The club's crest, Puma logo and Fly Emirates are all in luminous pink, as is the collar on the shirt. 
Courtesy of Footy Headlines, you can get a closer look at the rumoured away kit here: 
Arsenal fans, would you be with having these designs as your kits next season? 
Let us know your thoughts in the comments. 
Before you go, check out the top 10 worst football shirts in history: Sponsored Links
